title: The Block's Andy and Deb's car stolen as show is embroiled in shocking crime scandal
text:
The Block's Deb Saunders, 46 recently found herself in hot water with foreman Keith Schleiger for stealing a hammer from his workbelt.

And it seems karma has caught up with the homeware store owner from Manning Valley, NSW, as she has become a victim of crime.

According TV Week, Deb and Andy recently had their car stolen and are now involved in special crimes investigation, with police trying to locate the missing vehicle.

Dude, Where's Our Car? A special crimes investigation team swoops in on The Block as Deb Saunders's vehicle gets stolen during filming for show

The ordeal will play out on this week's episode of The Block, where viewers will see Deb step out from a shop, only to realise that her car has been stolen.

A panic stricken Deb makes husband Andy take another look around the car park for the vehicle before the duo report the incident to the police.

'Someone stole my car' she says, before explaining that she has been out of sorts during filming, going 'loopy from lack of sleep'.

The duo were particularly concerned as the car, valued at over $50,000 is on loan from Channel Nine and show sponsor Volkswagen to use while on the show.

Stand-up comedian Andy, 48, who has performed at the Melbourne International Comedy Festival, admits his surprise that someone would dare steal the car.

'It's so traceable', he says, before pointing out 'But it'd be like climbing Everest for your car thieves'.

'They'd be like, "I've done it! I've stolen a Block car!",' he adds.

Gone In 60 Seconds: The car, valued at over $50,000 was on loan from Channel Nine and the show's sponsor Volkswagen, given to each team to use while competing on the show

Despite Andy's jokes, it appears police are not treating the situation as a laughing matter, with a the Special Crimes Investigation Unit assigned to the case.

Daily Mail Australia has contacted Channel Nine for comment about the missing vehicle.

The Block airs on Sunday at 7pm and Monday at 7:30pm on Channel Nine.
